Comments_List: My French vocabulary greatly improved and I gained a lot of confidence using different verb tenses. The readings were much more advanced than French 130 and I felt I was given the tools to read and discuss those materials.

I thought the homework assignments and daily class discussions did a good job of preparing us for exams and speaking French. Expectations for class and exams were always clear. There was a good balance of speaking, listening, reading, and writing.
With a small class size, my oral speaking skills improved a lot. L4 is not as much work as L3, but it is still time consuming.

I would recommend this course to a student interested in improving their conversational French and grammar. I think this class greatly built on the Foundation that L3 laid down and made me much more comfortable speaking French.
Definitely. My French skills improved a lot and the course material was interesting.
